Videos 9, 10, and 11 have no audio. I've tried them in several different movie players and I've checked the audio tracks. Its just white noise.

I'm wondering why you screen-captured the movies? Screen-capture is the last resort when you can't work out a way of downloading the original movie files, but you tend to end up with large file sizes plus poor video quality. I'm running Snow Leopard, and none of the videos work properly with any video player (from VLC to QuickTime), and VLC reports that the link between video and audio has been broken but can't repair it. On my computer the videos play at 10 times their normal speed and often without any sound. I will have to trash all 5 gigs worth. At which point can I really say THANKS FOR THE UPLOAD?
If you want good complete software video training with exercise files, go to Demonoid instead.
